When a root cause and a workaround are identified for a problem, the next step is typically to document a Known Error in the system. A Known Error includes the Root Cause of the issue and the Workaround, providing a quick reference for resolving the issue if it occurs again.

Selected Answer: B
When a problem is Closed, it typically cannot be reopened after a certain period (e.g., 7 or 14 days, depending on system configurations). If management wants to revisit the root cause analysis after some time, they should use the Re-Analyze action, which allows re-examining the problem without violating ITIL best practices. The Problem Manager is the appropriate role to perform this action, as they oversee problem investigations and ensure they align with business needs.
